subject: Re: HttpUnit group? - Group found...
msgSnippet: After exchanging email with Russell Gold httpunit s creator he pointed to the list at: http://lists.sourceforge.net/mailman/listinfo/httpunit-develop Which
messageBody:
After exchanging email with Russell Gold httpunit's creator he
pointed to the list at:


http://lists.sourceforge.net/mailman/listinfo/httpunit-develop




Which despite it's title is indeed the place to go for community-
albiet a small one- discussion and support. So hopefully that helps
more people than just myself.




<end of relevant discussion>




<offline>


As for the rest of the overhead...




A search of google is where the quest began. My description of it
being quick was more to cover the fact that there was a possibility
that I could have overlooked something. So yes a suggestion of
something fairly obvious is rather grating/annoying and not helpful.
Perhaps also it was more the phrasing. But I digress...


I figured this audience was the next most likely place to find a
group if one existed considering the overlap in audience between the
tools. I didn't expected more than a curteous response. But alas such
is the joy of the internet. In any event it is in the past and the
answer was found.




--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@d...> wrote:


> There does not appear to be a Yahoo! group, but there are mailing


> lists. Google will help you find them, as will
http://www.httpunit.org


>


> I think the answer was closer to, "Spend a little more time with


> Google."


>


> I agree that someone in an agitated state of mind might find it


> gratuitously rude, but it seems common and accepted to point out
when a


> simple web search would find the answer.


>


> In the specific case of the Yahoo! groups, though, if Google can't
find


> it, it definitely ain't there. :)


>


> Good luck.


>


> So said tsudonymn <tsudonymn@y...> on 2003-01-08


> --------------------


>


> >So the answer is you don't know.


> >


> >


> >


> >


> > And no, a search (albiet quick one) of google did not net any


> >reference to such a group. Thus the question.


> >


> >


> >


> >


> >--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Alain Ravet <alain.ravet.list@w...>


> >wrote:
